metadata.title: CVE-2017-7784 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free vulnerability can occur when reading an image observerduring frame reconstruction after the observer has been freed. This resultsin a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird< 52.3, Firefox ESR < 52.3, and Firefox < 55.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7784` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 55.0.2+build1-0ubuntu4
firefox-geckodriver - 55.0.2+build1-0ubuntu4
firefox-mozsymbols - 55.0.2+build1-0ubuntu4
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '55.0.2+build1-0ubuntu4').
thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu2').
